Package networks

Class NeuralNetworkD

  • java.lang.Object
    • networks.NeuralNetworkD
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NeuralNetwork
    public class NeuralNetworkD
extends java.lang.Object
implements NeuralNetwork
    NeuralNetworkF is a simple implementation of a neural network using matrices. Uses double as basic calculation unit.
    Author:
    OdinhengeT
    See Also:
    NeuralNetwork, NeuralNetworkF, LayerD

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      NeuralNetworkD​(int[] layerStruct, double learningRate)
      Creates a NeuralNetwork with nbrLayers Layers with nbrLinks and nbrNeurons as provided by argument.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      char getBasicCalculationUnit()
      Returns 'd' signifying that this NeuralNetwork has double as its basic calculation unit.
      double[] run​(double[] input)
      The NeuralNetwork is given an input vector (double), and calculates an output vector (double) by passing its values through the NeuralNetwork.
      float[] run​(float[] input)
      run(float[]) is set to throw IllegalCallerException, double-based implementation.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String representation of the NeuralNetwork.
      void train​(double[][] input, double[][] target)
      Trains the NeuralNetwork, using multiple vector inputs (double) and their corresponding target vectors (double), by updating the weights and biases in its MatrixLayers using backpropagation and gradient descent.
      void train​(float[][] input, float[][] target)
      train(float[][], float[][]) is set to throw IllegalCallerException, double-based implementation.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • NeuralNetworkD

        public NeuralNetworkD​(int[] layerStruct,
                      double learningRate)
        Creates a NeuralNetwork with nbrLayers Layers with nbrLinks and nbrNeurons as provided by argument. The first Layer is an InputMatrixLayer, the last Layer is an OutputMatrixLayer and the Layers in between are InnerMatrixLayers. The Network has a learningRate defined in argument.
        Parameters:
        learningRate - the NeuralNetworkF's rate of learning
        layerStruct - an int[] with length equal to the number of Layers of the NeuralNetwork, and values equal to the number of Neurons (excluding eventual BiasNeurons)

      • run

        public double[] run​(double[] input)
        The NeuralNetwork is given an input vector (double), and calculates an output vector (double) by passing its values through the NeuralNetwork.
        Specified by:
        run in interface NeuralNetwork
        Parameters:
        input - a double[] of input values to the NeuralNetwork
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if nbr inputs != nbr InputNeurons

      • train

        public void train​(double[][] input,
                  double[][] target)
        Trains the NeuralNetwork, using multiple vector inputs (double) and their corresponding target vectors (double), by updating the weights and biases in its MatrixLayers using backpropagation and gradient descent.
        Specified by:
        train in interface NeuralNetwork
        Parameters:
        input - , multiple vector inputs (double) gathered in an array
        target - , multiple vector targets (double) corresponding to the input vectors in input
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if input and target are of different length
